message: The validation technical components are present.
[Section C Check 1.a] A FedRAMP SSP must define its sensitivity level.

[Section C Check 1.a] A FedRAMP SSP must have an allowed sensitivity
                level.

A FedRAMP SSP must implement a statement for each of the following lettered response points for required
                controls: .

The following 
                 are required: .
[Section C Check 3] A FedRAMP SSP must implement the most important controls.
[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must implement all required controls.

[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must not include implemented controls beyond what is required for
                the applied baseline.
[Section C Check 2] Implementation status is correct.
[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must have required response points.

[Section D Checks] Response statements have sufficient
                components.
[Section D Checks] Response statement does not have a description not within a component.
[Section D Checks] Response statement does not have remarks not within a component.

[Section D Checks] Response
                statement cites a component in the system implementation inventory.

[Section D Checks] Response statement has a component which has a required
                description.

[Section D Checks] Response statement component description has adequate
                length.

[Section D Checks] Response statement component remarks have adequate
                length.

[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous
                roles.

[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous
                parties.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation has a unique identifier.
Every declared embedded attachment has a filename attribute.
Every declared embedded attachment has a media type.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a unique identifier.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation should have a title.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a rlink element.

Every supporting artifact found in a citation should be
                referenced from within the document.
A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an allowed attachment type.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation rlink must have a reference.
A media-type attribute must have an allowed value.
A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an embedded attachment element.
A supporting artifact found in a citation must have only one embedded attachment element.
Every embedded attachment element must have a filename attribute.
Every embedded attachment element must have a media type.

Every
                embedded attachment element must have content.

A FedRAMP
                OSCAL SSP must have the FedRAMP Master Acronym and Glossary attached.

[Section
                B Check 3.12] A FedRAMP SSP must have the FedRAMP Applicable Laws and Regulations attached.

A FedRAMP OSCAL
                SSP must have the FedRAMP Logo attached.

[Section B Check
                3.2] A FedRAMP SSP must have a User Guide attached.

[Section
                B Check 3.5] A FedRAMP SSP must have Rules of Behavior.
[Section B Check 3.6] A FedRAMP SSP must have a Contingency Plan attached.
[Section B Check 3.7] A FedRAMP SSP must have a Configuration Management Plan attached.
[Section B Check 3.8] A FedRAMP SSP must have an Incident Response Plan attached.
[Section B Check 3.11] A FedRAMP SSP must have a Separation of Duties Matrix attached.

[Section B Check 3.1] A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy
                document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.

[Section B
                Check 3.1] A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control
                families.

[Section B Check 3.1] A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure
                document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.

[Section
                B Check 3.1] A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control
                families.
[Section B Check 3.1] Policy and procedure documents must have unique per-control-family associations.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate
                a Privacy Point of Contact role.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP
                OSCAL SSP must declare a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference.

[Section B Check
                3.4] A FedRAMP SSP must declare a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference identifying the party by unique
                identifier.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP SSP must define a
                Privacy Point of Contact.

[Section B Check 3.4] A Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA)
                qualifying question must have an allowed answer.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP SSP must have a privacy-sensitive
                designation.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL
                SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #1.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL
                SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #2.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL
                SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #3.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL
                SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #4.

[Section
                B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP SSP must have all four PTA questions.

[Section
                B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP SSP must have no duplicate PTA questions.
[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP SSP may have a SORN ID.
[Section B Check 3.4] This FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a Privacy Impact Analysis.
A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate one or more FIPS 140 validated modules.
Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have a validation reference.
Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have validation details.

A validation reference must provide a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP)
                certificate number.

A validation reference must be
                in accord with its sibling validation details.

A validation
                details must refer to a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page.

A validation details link
                must be in accord with its sibling validation reference.
[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify a FIPS 199 categorization.
[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify a security impact level.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security sensitivity
                level.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify a confidentiality security
                objective.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify an integrity security
                objective.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify an availability security
                objective.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security objective
                value.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify at least one information type.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have a title.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have a description.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have at least one categorization.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have a confidentiality impact.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have an integrity impact.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have an availability impact.
A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a system attribute.

A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a correct system
                attribute.

A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have at least one information type
                identifier.

A FedRAMP SSP information type identifier must be chosen from those found in NIST SP
                800-60v2r1.

A FedRAMP SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must specify the base
                impact.

A FedRAMP SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must the selected
                impact.

A FedRAMP SSP must indicate for its information system the appropriate categorization for the respective
                confidentiality, integrity, impact levels of its information types (per FIPS-199).

[Section B
                Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP must have a Digital Identity Determination property.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital
                Identity Determination identity assurance level property.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital
                Identity Determination authenticator assurance level property.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital
                Identity Determination federation assurance level property.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP must have a Digital Identity Determination
                property with an allowed value.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital
                Identity Determination identity assurance level.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital
                Identity Determination authenticator assurance level.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital
                Identity Determination federation assurance level.
A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate inventory items.
Every asset identifier must be unique.
An asset type must have an allowed value.
A virtual property must have an allowed value.
A public property must have an allowed value.
An allows-authenticated-scan property has an allowed value.
is-scanned property must have an allowed value.
A scan-type property must have an allowed value.
A component must have an allowed type.
A component must have an asset type.
A component must have only one asset type.
An inventory item has a unique identifier.
An inventory item must have an asset identifier.
An inventory item must have only one asset identifier.
An inventory item must have an asset-type.
An inventory item must have only one asset-type.
An inventory item must have a virtual property.
An inventory item must have only one virtual property.
An inventory item must have a public property.
An inventory item must have only one public property.
An inventory item must have a scan-type property.
An inventory item has only one scan-type property.

"infrastructure" inventory item has
                allows-authenticated-scan.

An inventory item has
                one-allows-authenticated-scan property.

"infrastructure" inventory item has
                baseline-configuration-name.

"infrastructure" inventory item has only
                one baseline-configuration-name.

"infrastructure"
                inventory item has a vendor-name property.
"infrastructure" inventory item must have only one vendor-name property.

"infrastructure"
                inventory item must have a hardware-model property.
"infrastructure" inventory item must have only one hardware-model property.

"infrastructure" inventory item must have is-scanned
                property.

"infrastructure" inventory item must have only one
                is-scanned property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a
                software-name property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a
                software-name property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a
                software-version property.

"software or database" inventory item must
                have one software-version property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a function
                property.

"software or database" inventory item must have one
                function property.

A FedRAMP SSP must have a self-referential (i.e., to the SSP itself)
                component.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a FedRAMP system identifier.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a system name.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a short system name.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a FedRAMP authorization type.
The System Owner role must be defined.
The Authorizing Official role must be defined.
The System Management PoC role must be defined.
The System Technical PoC role must be defined.
The System Other PoC role must be defined.

The Information System Security Officer role must be
                defined.
The Authorizing Official PoC role must be defined.
A role must have a title.
One or more responsible parties must be defined for each role.

Each responsible party must identify a person using that
                person's unique identifier.
Each person should have a responsibility.
Each implemented control must have one or more responsible-role definitions.
Each responsible-role must reference a role definition.

Each responsible-role must be referenced in a system-implementation user
                assembly.
Every user has a role identifier.
Every user has a user type.
Every user has a privilege-level.
Every user has a sensitivity level.
Every user has one or more authorized privileges.
Each identified role must reference a role definition.
User type property has an allowed value.
User privilege level has an allowed value.
User sensitivity level has an allowed value.
Every authorized privilege has a title.
Every authorized privilege is associated with one or more functions performed.
Every authorized privilege title is not empty.
Every authorized privilege function performed has a definition.
A FedRAMP SSP includes an authorization boundary.
A FedRAMP SSP has an authorization boundary description.
A FedRAMP SSP has at least one authorization boundary diagram.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a unique identifier.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link rel attribute.

Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link rel attribute with the value
                "diagram".

A FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram link
                references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
A FedRAMP SSP includes a network architecture diagram.
A FedRAMP SSP has a network architecture description.
A FedRAMP SSP has at least one network architecture diagram.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a unique identifier.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".

A FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram link
                references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
A FedRAMP SSP includes a data flow diagram.
A FedRAMP SSP has a data flow description.
A FedRAMP SSP has at least one data flow diagram.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a unique identifier.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".

A FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram link references a
                back-matter resource representing the diagram document.

A FedRAMP SSP declares the related FedRAMP OSCAL Profile using an import-profile
                element.
The import-profile element has a reference.

Every implemented requirement
                has an implementation-status property.
Planned control implementations have a planned completion date.

Every implemented requirement has a
                control origin.

Every
                implemented requirement has an allowed control origin.

Every implemented requirement with a control origin of "inherited" references a leveraged
                authorization.
Incomplete control implementations have an explanation.
Planned completion date is valid.
Planned completion date is not past.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud service model.

A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed cloud service
                model.
A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud deployment model.

A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed cloud
                deployment model.
A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud deployment model of "hybrid-cloud" must supply remarks.

When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be
                employed.
